text:
Momoland, a six-member girl band that debuted in 2016, has many viral tracks under its belt. It is best know for songs "BBoom BBoom" and "BAAM" which have amassed over 500 million and 240 million views on YouTube. The other two, nine-member boy band BLANK2Y and six-member girl band Lapillus, are rookie groups. Also taking part in the event would be a starcast of dance crews and local artists like singer Noo Phuoc Thinh and rapper Phao, the Korea Tourism Organisation announced on its Facebook page. The KTO said the Korea Culture And Tourism Days on December 17-18 would also feature stations where people could try traditional South Korean games and traditional crafts, street singing and dance competitions. More information about the free event is available on the page. Subscribe the VnExpress International Subsidiary of VnExpress

title: K-pop groups to perform at Hanoi Korean cultural festival this weekend - VnExpress International
